$!You may need to tell DVLA if you have glaucoma.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don't tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you're involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

### If glaucoma only affects one eye 

You don't need to tell DVLA provided you have no medical condition in the other eye and you're still able to meet the ['visual standards for driving'](/driving-eyesight-rules "Driving eyesight rules").

For more information read the vision information leaflet 'VIS1'.

$D
[Download 'VIS1 - A guide to standards of vision for driving cars and motorcycles' (PDF, 209KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065298.pdf "Download leaflet 'VIS1: A guide to standards of vision for driving cars and motorcycles' (PDF, 209KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D


### If glaucoma affects both eyes

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download 'V1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 253KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065620.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download 'V1V - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 261KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065275.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You may need to tell DVLA If you have glaucoma – if you do, download the correct form to let them know
title: Glaucoma and driving
